result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall R. Baughman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Psilocin (<=100 g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(g)1.
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.   Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence shall be served on or before April 8, 2017 by 4:30 p.m.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs. 

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Defendant Randall R. Baughman in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty placed agreement on the record.  Argument on jail sentence. Ct. 2 - Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 30 months with the following conditions:  60 days in County Jail with Huber; court costs; DNA sample; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant Randall R. Baughman in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laufenberg is requesting that the plea will take place today and sentencing at a later date in December. Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to counts 2 and 3.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3.  Court dismisses and read in Counts 1, 4 and 5. This bond is being ordered in place of the cash bond previously ordered. *Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court. Defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin for employment purposes in Iowa. Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall take any prescribed medications at the dosage and time prescribed by his physician.

Defendant Randall R. Baughman in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits of preliminary hearing.  Bond continued. Attorney Nocco is requesting that defendant leave the State of Wisconsin to work in the State of Iowa.  Court grants Attorney's Nocco's request.  Court changes payment plan to be combined into one payment plan; $50.00 due today and $150.00 a month thereafter beginning 30 days from today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  - rt

Taylor County Arrest Report

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Randall R. Baughman appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Court questions defendant.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $2,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court orders bond as requested by the district attorney.  Court orders that the criminal complaint is to be filed within five business days.  Next court date is September 8, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
